CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: Tilfredsstillende 1. kvartal for SpareBank 1 Vest    Konsernet SpareBank 1 Vest har et resultat før skatt på 100   millioner kroner ved utløpet av 1 kvartal 2000. I samme   periode i fjor var resultatet før skatt på 146   millioner kroner,inklusive gevinst på anleggsmidler på 51   millioner kroner.     Konsernet SpareBank 1 Vests resultat etter skatt er i   første kvartal 2000 på 71 millioner kroner, mot 121   millioner kroner samme periode i 1999. Annualisert   egenkapitalavkastning er på 14,9 prosent, mot 29,5 prosent   samme periode i 1999.Til tross for en resultatreduksjon i   forhold til 1 kvartal 1999, sier SpareBank 1 Vest seg   fornøyd med at det er tilfredsstillende inntjening i   bankens basisvirksomhet, stabil vekst i utlån og innskudd,   og at misligholdsgraden er redusert i forhold til i fjor.   Det er også gledelig at nettbanktilbudet er blitt meget   godt mottatt og at kundenes bruk av denne tjenesten øker   sterkt.    Konsernets rentenetto var ved utgangen av første kvartal   2000 på 179 millioner kroner, mot 169 millioner kroner   samme periode i 1999. Rentenettoen i prosent av   gjennomsnittlig forvaltningskapital utgjorde 2,68 prosent,   mot 2,82 prosent samme periode i fjor. Første kvartals   rentenetto er 0.33 prosentenheter lavere pr.   gjennomsnittlige kapitalenhet enn i 4. kvartal 1999   isolert. Hensyntatt balansetilpasninger i år 2000 er   prosentvis nettorente ca på nivå med første kvartal 1999.  Driftskostnadene var ved utgangen av første kvartal 2000 på   150 millioner kroner mot 138 millioner kroner samme periode   i fjor. Dette gir en K/I-relasjon (driftskostnader i   forhold til resultat før driftskostnader) på 58,8 prosent   mot 55 prosent samme periode i fjor. Kostnadsveksten finner   i sin helhet sted i gruppen andre driftskostnader og   skyldes i hovedsak at banken har besluttet å flytte sin   databehandling til EDB-Fellesdata. Konverteringen er   planlagt å finne sted i påsken 2001 og er beregnet til å   koste netto ca 30 millioner kroner i 2000 - herav er en   fjerdedel kostnadsført og avsatt i første kvartal.      Videre reflekterer kostnadsveksten bankens økte satsing på   banktjenester over internett og kostnader i forbindelse med   utvikling og implementering av ny Nettbank. SpareBank 1   Vest har nå om lag 18.000 nettbankkunder. I første kvartal   2000 var tilveksten på 5000 nye brukere og veksthastigheten   ligger på ca 400 nye brukere pr uke. I mars 2000 betalte   nettbankkundene ca 85000 giroer elektronisk. Dette er fem   ganger høyere enn i mai måned 1999.    Bankens forvaltningskapital har økt med 3,5 milliarder   kroner i løpet av de siste tolv månedene, til 28 milliarder   kroner ved utgangen av første kvartal 2000.     Forvaltningsveksten har vært på knappe 1.8 mrd kr siden   årsskiftet. Veksten i første kvartal gir en annualisert   vekst på ca 30%. Denne økningen er ikke representativ for   vekstforventningene for året. Det skyldes særlig at banken   har posisjonert seg likviditetsmessig for overtakelse av   virksomhet knyttet til SpareBank 1`s mulige overtakelse av   Vår Bank og Forsikring og at banken har økt sine   beholdninger av sertifikater og obligasjoner med sikte på å   ha god handlefrihet for låneopptak i Norges Bank.    Bankens utlån utgjorde ved utgangen av første kvartal 2000   ca 23 milliarder kroner. Dette er om lag 2.2 milliarder   kroner (10,8 prosent) høyere enn 12 måneder tidligere.    Veksten siden årsskiftet er på vel 0.6 milliarder kroner,   tilsvarende en annualisert årsvekst på 11,7 prosent.   Innskudd fra kunder utgjør 16.3 milliarder kroner. Veksten   siden årsskiftet er på 600 millioner kroner, noe som gir et   annualisert vekstestimat for innskudd i 2000 på rundt 15   prosent. Bankens samlede finansieringsgrad er ved utgangen   av første kvartal 2000 på 71 prosent, mot 71,3 prosent   samme periode i 1999.    Netto tapskostnader utgjorde ved utgangen av første kvartal   4 millioner kroner, mot 18 millioner kroner samme periode i   fjor. Misligholdsgraden er på 1,1 prosent, hvilket er   innenfor det nivået som banken har definert som   akseptabelt, og 0,5 prosentenheter lavere enn for ett år   siden.    Konsernets samlede kapitaldekning er på 10,82 prosent mot   9,94 prosent første kvartal 1999.     I resten av året vil både datakonverteringen og en   eventuell Vår-integrasjon medføre en del engangskostnader.   Det er styrets oppfatning at disse kostnadene forsvares i   et langsiktig perspektiv ved at de legger til rette for mer   effektiv drift og for høyere inntjening.   Nevnte engangskostnader samt utviklingen i rentenettoen   setter imidlertid bankens inntjening under press. På dette   grunnlag er målet for egenkapitalavkastning på 12% etter   skatt rimelig ambisiøst.    Halvårsresultatet for banken legges frem 3. august 2000.
TITLE: SVEG - Delårsregnskap 1/00

TEXT: SpareBank 1 Vest har besluttet å sette opp innskudds- og   utlånsrenten.  Innskudds og utlånsrenten øker med inntil   0,45 prosentpoeng.    Renteøkningen gjelder både i personkundemarkedet og   bedriftskundemarkedet.  For nye lån vil renteøkningen ha   effekt fra og med tirsdag 30. mai 2000, mens renteøkningen   ellers vil ha virkning for bankens kunder fra og med 29.   juni 2000.    Laveste nominelle rente på boliglån innenfor 60 prosent av   takst blir dermed på 6,95 prosent.  Innenfor 80 prosent av   takst blir laveste nominelle rente på 7,45 prosent.  Den   effektive boliglånsrenten blir på henholdsvis 7,28 prosent   og 7,80 prosent, basert på et lån på 500.000 kroner med en   løpetid på 15 år.  Lån med pant i bil blir fra 8,65 prosent,   nominelt.    Renteøkningen kommer som følge av økt pengemarkedsrente samt   Norges Banks renteøkning for vel en måned siden.
TITLE: SVEG - SETTER OPP RENTEN

TEXT: Stolt-Nielsen S.A. and Aspen Technology Form Alliance for   Chemical Industry Supply chain Logistic    Strategic relationshop provides industry.specific   optimization software to integrate and streamline   manufacturing, logistics planning and execution.    London, England/Cambridge, mass. March 14, 2000-   Stolt-nielsen S.A. (NASDAQ: STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock   Exchange: SNIB) and Aspen Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: AZPN),   today announced an alliance to provide optimization software   that integrates manufacturing, logistics planning and   execution for the chemical industry. Aspen Technology is   the leading supplier of manufacturing enterprices   optimization and e-business solutions for the process   industries. Stolt-Nielsen provides the world`s leading   network of transportation and storage services for bulk   liquid chemicals, acid, edible oils and other specialty   liquids.    The alliance combines Stolt-Nielsen S.A.`s expertise in   chemical logistics, supply chain management and   transportation with Aspen Tech`sexpertise in enterprise   optimization solutions, which includes Aspen eBusinessTM,   for process-based industries. Both organizations will   leverage their supply chain and Internet initiatives through   the alliance; and Profit Point Inc. a consulting services   provider, will support the alliance`s offering through the   delivery of supply chain and e-business services.    `The alliance is designed to help both companies` mutural   customers capture revenue by linking the manufacturing and   logistics planning optimization process,` said Frank   Kleinschrodt, AspenTech Senior Vise President responsible   for Aspen eBusiness. `Currently, these operations are   performed separately. By combining the strengths of   Stolt-Nielsen and AspenTch, chemical processing managers   will have a complete view of the entire supply chain,   giving them the information they need to make optimal   decisions for the enterprise as a whole.`    `Chemical companies want to reduce costs as much as   possible,` said Jacob Stolt-Nielsen, Chairman and CEO   Stolt-Nielsen. `The most promising avenues for cost   reduction include simplifying and accelerating the   manufacturing and logistics planning and execution   processes. The alliance`s global optimization product will   help our mutual customers realize such savings.`    The new Stolt-Nielsen S.A. /AspenTech optimization product   will be linked to ChemLink.com, Stolt-Nielsen`s logistical   portal. Currently, ChemLink.com books and tracks bulk liquid   cargoes on parcel tankers, tank containers and rail cars, as   weill as bulk liquid stored in terminal facilities. With the   implementation of this new solution, the result will be   improved coordination of the entire value chain, integrating   manufacturing optimization with the various back-office   systems of carries, surveyors, freight forwarders and other   parties involved in the delivery process.    `Process manufacturers need integrated manufacturing and   logistics optimization processes in order to respond to   changes in supply and demand in real-time,` said   Kleinschrodt. `The combination of Stolt-Nielsen S.A. `s   Internet-based logistics with AspenTech`s e-business   optimization solutions and Profit Point`s consulting   services provides the first complete solution for bulk   liquid logistics in the chermical industry.`
TITLE: SNIB - ALLIANCE WITH ASPEN TECHNOLOGY

TEXT: Stamford, Connecticut (March 20, 2000)- In a bid to unlock   $43 billion of hidden value in the bulk material supply   chain, Optimum Logistics Ltd. today announced plans for the   first Internetbased, open logistics system for bulk   materials. Optimum Logistics, a new company spawned from   Stolt-Nielsen S.A. (Nasdaq: STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock   Exchange: SNIB), will connect all participants in the global   supply chain at Internet speed.    Optimum`s principal offering will be TransLink tm, an online   logistics system that electronically arranges and monitors   all stages of the supply chain by incorporation and storage   providers, to freight forwarders and surveyors.    Stolt Nielsen plans to dilute its stake in Optimum to a   minority position. Towards this end, Optimum is engaging   strategic capital partners focused on the   business-to-business e-commerce arena.
TITLE: SNIB - AD OPTIMUM LOGISTIC

CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: Three months ended.    Thousand dollars                                Feb.29.00           Feb.28.99  Tot.net.op.rev                 499,406             407,352  Tot.gros.prof.                  56,620              54,108  Tot.inc.fr.op.                  10,827              15,435  Net.inc                         30,048               7,726  Tot.ass.                     3,778,857           2,963,162  Tot.cur.il.                    786,626             456,073  Tot.cur.non.curr.li.         2,622,226           1,853,072  Sharehol.eq.                 1,156,631           1,110,090    STOLT NIELSEN S.A. REPORTS FIRST QUARTER RESULTS    London, England - March 28, 2000 - Stolt-Nielsen S.A.   (Nasdaq:STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock Exchange:SNIB) today   reported results for the first quarter ended February 29,   2000.  Net income for the latest quarter was $30.0 million,   or $0.55 per Common and Class B Share, on net operating   revenue of $499.4 million, compared with net income of $7.7   million, or $0.14 per Common and Class B Share, on net   operating revenue of $407.4 million for the first quarter of   1999.  Before one-off gains resulting from the dilution in   Stolt-Nielsen S.A.`s (SNSA) interest in Stolt Comex Seaway   S.A. and the sale of assets, the loss for the latest quarter   was $3.7 million or $0.07 per Common and Class B Share   compared with a profit of $3.8 million or $0.07 per Common   and Class B Share for the first quarter of 1999 before a   one-off gain from the sales of assets.  The weighted average   number of Common and Class B Shares outstanding for the   quarter was 54.6 million compared with 54.5 million for the   same period in 1999.     Commenting on the results, Christopher J. Wright, President   of Stolt-Nielsen S.A. said `While Stolt-Nielsen   Transportation Group`s markets continued to recover in the   first quarter, the effects of increased demand were largely   offset by bunker costs for the   Stolt-Nielsen Transportation Group`s parcel tanker division   and higher interest expense resulting from newbuilding   deliveries.  Stolt Comex Seaway S.A. reported weaker results   due to depressed markets continuing in the UK sector of the   North Sea, the Gulf of Mexico, and Asia Pacific as well as   weather related delays in the North Sea.  Stolt Sea Farm   posted another record quarter with improvements in all   regions compared to last year.      `The Company`s offer to exchange Common Shares for Class B   shares resulted in a 95% acceptance and a 57% increase in   the free float of the Class B Share.  Earlier this month,   the Company announced the formation of Optimum Logistics   Ltd. that has developed TransLink?, the first   internet-based, open logistics system for bulk products.    `For the Stolt-Nielsen Transportation Group Ltd. (SNTG)   income from operations rose to $19.5 million from $12.2   million in the first quarter of 1999 as a result of stronger   markets.
TITLE: SNIB - DELÅRSRESULTAT I

CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: `The Stolt Tankers Joint Service Sailed-in Index was on par   with the latter half of 1999.  Income from operations for   SNTG`s parcel tanker division increased to $9.0 million from   $4.8 million in the first quarter of 1999.  Improvements   from increased volumes were largely offset by higher bunker   costs.  Contracts of affreightment were renewed at levels   comparable or slightly higher than the prior year.    `SNTG`s tank container division`s income from operations   increased to $4.9 million from $3.8 million in the first   quarter of 1999 as the economies of Asia Pacific and Latin   America continue to improve.  SNTG`s worldwide tank   container shipment activity during the first quarter was   some 20% higher than the depressed level of the first   quarter of 1999.    `SNTG`s terminal division continued to post improved results   with income from operations increasing to $5.6 million from   $3.6 million in the first quarter of 1999 as results   improved in all terminals including the joint ventures in   Asia Pacific.    `During the quarter, SNTG announced plans to develop a new   terminal on the east bank of the Mississippi River in   Braithwaite, Louisiana.  As SNTG`s parcel tanker fleet now   makes about 200 ship calls and almost 600 berth calls a year   in the Mississippi River, this ship terminal should help   reduce the total transportation cost for bulk liquids by   creating an efficient distribution hub in the region.    `Before minority interests, Stolt Comex Seaway S.A. (SCS)   reported a net loss of $15.7 million for the quarter down   from a profit of $0.6 million in the first quarter of 1999.    Market conditions throughout the quarter in the UK sector of   the North Sea, the Gulf of Mexico, and Asia Pacific   continued to be very weak.  In addition to this the North   Sea has experienced exceptionally severe weather which has   resulted in the delays of three projects.  The integration   of ETPM into the SCS organization is proceeding well.  The   previously announced synergies and savings from bringing the   two companies together will start to show from the second   half of this year.  While it is anticipated that market   conditions will remain weak for the remainder of 2000, there   are now clear indications of a significant increase in   market volume in 2001 with the level of bids outstanding for   2001 at a record level.    `Stolt Sea Farm Holdings Ltd.`s (SSF) income from operations   improved to $10.1 million from $0.5 million in the first   quarter of 1999.  Salmon operations in North America and   Norway both benefited from higher prices, lower costs, and   increased volumes.  Salmon operations in the UK also showed   a marked improvement and SSF`s operations in Iberia and Asia   continued to deliver strong results.  During the quarter,   SSF began to sell caviar over the internet at   www.sterlingcaviar.com.    `The Company announced the formation of Optimum Logistics   Ltd.  Optimum`s initial product will be TransLink*, an   online logistics system that electronically arranges and   monitors all stages of the bulk materials supply chain by   incorporating information from every party that touches a   shipment -- from producers, to transportation and storage   providers, to freight forwarders.  SNSA plans to dilute its   stake in Optimum to a minority position.  Towards this end,   Optimum is engaging strategic partners focused on the   business-to-business e-commerce arena.
TITLE: SNIB - DELÅRSRESULTAT II

CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: `The Company completed its exchange offer of one Class B   Share for each outstanding Common Share during the first   quarter.  As a result of the exchange offer, 7.8 million   Common Shares were exchanged for Class B Shares, leaving   approximately 0.5 million publicly held Common Shares.  At   the commencement of the exchange offer, the Company   indicated that it or its affiliates might from time to time   seek to acquire additional outstanding Common Shares held by   unaffiliated holders by means of one or more tender offers,   exchange offers, open market purchases or negotiated   transactions.  To that end, the Company intends to commence   an odd-lot program with respect to both Common Shares and   Class B shareholders after the Annual General Meeting of   Shareholders on April 13, 2000.  The program will provide   odd-lot shareholders with a convenient means to dispose of   their shares without incurring high brokerage commissions.    Further details with respect to the odd-lot program will be   provided to shareholders in April.    `Although the markets for our two largest businesses remain   difficult we believe both will improve as the world economy   strengthens and oil companies increase their investment   programs.  Meanwhile the prospects for our e-commerce   venture is very exciting and we expect a continued strong   performance from Stolt Sea Farm.` Mr. Wright said in   conclusion.    Stolt-Nielsen S.A. is one of the world`s leading providers   of transportation services for bulk liquid chemicals, edible   oils, acids, and other specialty liquids.  The Company,   through its parcel tanker, tank container, terminal, rail   and barge services, provides integrated transportation for   its customers. The Company also owns 48 percent of Stolt   Comex Seaway S.A. (Nasdaq:SCSWF, SCSAY; Oslo Stock   Exchange:SCS, SCSA), which is among the largest subsea   services contractors in the world.  SCS specializes in   providing engineering, flowline and pipeline lay,   construction, inspection, and maintenance services to the   offshore oil and gas industry.  Stolt Sea Farm, wholly-owned   by the Company, produces and markets high quality Atlantic   salmon, salmon trout, turbot, halibut, sturgeon, and caviar.    This news release contains forward-looking statements as   defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act   of 1995.  Actual future results and trends could differ   materially from those set forth in such statements due to   various factors.  Additional information concerning these   factors is contained from time to time in the Company`s U.S.   SEC filings, including but not limited to the Company`s   report on Form 20-F for the year ended November 30, 1998.    Copies of these filings may be obtained by contacting the   Company or the U.S. SEC.
TITLE: SNIB - DELÅRSRESULTAT III

TEXT: Primesupplier launchers first total E-Procurement solution   for ship operators and owners.    Smart System Reduces Ship Operating By Automating and   Streamlining the Purchase and Delivery of Ship Supplies.    London-March 29, 2000-PrimeSupplier Ltd., today launched the   world`s first Internet-based total marine procurement system   to make all products and services needed for marine   operations available virtually anytime, anyplace, at the   lowest cost. The system enables ship operators to   electronically select, purchase and arrange delivery for all   the ship operators` needs for fuel, consumables, spare parts   and other services. PrimeSupplier employs a proprietary   supplier and price database to intelligently manage the   procurement process, including transportation.    Oslo Stock Exchange has received complete press releace.
TITLE: SNIB - PRIMES. LAUNC.FIRST TOT. E-PROCUR

TEXT: Viser til tidligere børsmelding, og vedlegger fullstendig   pressemelding.    PRIMESUPPLIER LAUNCHES FIRST TOTAL E-PROCUREMENT SOLUTION   FOR SHIP OPERATORS AND OWNERS     ?Smart? System Reduces Ship Operating Costs By Automating   and Streamlining the Purchase and Delivery of Ship Supplies     London ? March 29, 2000 ? PrimeSupplier Ltd., today launched   the world?s first Internet-based total marine procurement   system to make all products and services needed for marine   operations available virtually anytime, anyplace, at the   lowest cost.  The system enables ship operators to   electronically select, purchase and arrange delivery for all   the ship operators? needs for fuel, consumables, spare parts   and other services.  PrimeSupplier employs a proprietary   supplier and price database to intelligently manage the   procurement process, including transportation.     PrimeSupplier Ltd. builds on a proven electronic marine   procurement system developed by Stolt-Nielsen S.A. (Nasdaq:   STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock Exchange) over the past five years.    The company, together with Optimum Logistics Ltd., is the   second independent business-to-business e-commerce   enterprise established by Stolt-Nielsen S.A. in 2000.     PrimeSupplier?s principal offering, SeaSupplier, currently   serves 135 ships for seven ship operators.  Last year the   system processed more than 40,000 transactions with a value   of $150 million.  It will include a multi-channel logistics   system specially designed to address the complex   transportation and logistics challenges faced by ship   operators in managing their inventories and supply chains.    SeaSupplier enables ship operators to obtain the lowest   delivered costs by capitalizing on consortium contract   purchasing, competitive spot quoting and consolidated   freight management.  The highly automated system is designed   to reduce total transaction costs for suppliers and   purchasers alike.     Jacob B. Stolt-Nielsen, Chief Executive Officer of   PrimeSupplier Ltd., commented on the new venture,  ?We know   very well the need to lower ship operating costs without   reducing standards.  Intelligent material management is an   important part of cost control.  Through SeaSupplier, we   have achieved substantial savings for ship operators.   By automating and optimizing the purchasing and delivery   process, SeaSupplier enables suppliers to preserve their   margins while lowering the delivered cost.     PrimeSupplier Ltd. offers ship operators and suppliers a   completely integrated, proven system that manages the entire   buying process from requisition through invoice payment.    The system is unique, reliable and immediately available for   new customers.?     PrimeSupplier Ltd. is headquartered in Bermuda and has   subsidiaries in London and Houston.  Ship operators can   obtain additional information from Scott Forester,   Commercial Analyst, at +1 (281) 457 4997 or by visiting   www.primesupplier.net. TEXT: STOLT NIELSEN S.A. ANNOUNCES ODD LOT PROGRAM  TO ASSIST SMALL SHAREHOLDERS    London, England - June 1, 2000 - Stolt-Nielsen S.A.   (Nasdaq:STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock Exchange:SNIB) today   announced a voluntary, low-cost program through which all   shareholders owning less than 100 Common or Class B shares   of Stolt-Nielsen S.A. may conveniently sell all of their   shares through the mail.    Jacob Stolt-Nielsen, Chairman and CEO of Stolt-Nielsen S.A.,   said `Many of our shareholders who own less than 100 Common   or Class B shares received their shares as a result of   various transactions the Company has been involved in over   the years.  While we value all of our shareholders, we   recognize that the inconvenience and cost of brokerage   commissions and bank fees may have deterred some   shareholders who own less than 100 shares from making   transactions in the Company`s shares.`    Participants in the odd-lot program, which is voluntary,   will receive in cash a per share price equal to the weighted   average selling price of Stolt-Nielsen Class B shares on the   open-market for the program period of June 1, 2000 to July   17, 2000 as reported in The Wall Street Journal.  Common   shares will be converted to Class B shares for these   purposes.  Norwegian shareholders will have the option to   receive cash payment in Norwegian kroner.    This program will also enable odd-lot Common shareholders,   who may have missed the Common for Class B share exchange   offer in February, a convenient low cost method of selling   their Common shares.  At the completion of the share   exchange in February, approximately 7.8 million (or 95%) of   the approximately 8.4 million publicly held Common shares of   Stolt-Nielsen S.A. had been exchanged for Class B shares.    Since that time, an additional 0.2 million Common shares   have been exchanged leaving less than 0.4 million publicly   held Common shares outstanding.    Program information is being mailed today to eligible   shareholders, either directly or through institutions   holding their shares.  Questions should be directed to   Georgeson Shareholder Communications Corporation Inc., the   program manager at 1-800-733-1665 in the U.S. or   44-207-335-7280 outside the U.S.  Norwegian shareholders may   contact Den norske Bank for additional information at   47-22-48-32-20.     Stolt-Nielsen S.A. is one of the world`s leading providers   of transportation services for bulk liquid chemicals, edible   oils, acids, and other specialty liquids.  The Company,   through its parcel tanker, tank container, terminal, rail   and barge services, provides integrated transportation for   its customers. The Company also owns 53 percent of Stolt   Offshore S.A. (Nasdaq:SCSWF, SCSAY; Oslo Stock Exchange:SCS,   SCSA), which is among the largest subsea services   contractors in the world.  Stolt Offshore specializes in   providing engineering, flowline and pipeline lay,   construction, inspection, and maintenance services to the   offshore oil and gas industry.  Stolt Sea Farm, wholly-owned   by the Company, produces and markets high quality Atlantic   salmon, salmon trout, turbot, halibut, sturgeon, and caviar.    This news release contains forward-looking statements as   defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act   of 1995.  Actual future results and trends could differ   materially from those set forth in such statements due to   various factors.  Additional information concerning these   factors is contained from time to time in the Company`s U.S.   SEC filings, including but not limited to the Company`s   report on Form 20-F for the year ended November 30, 2000.    Copies of these filings may be obtained by contacting the   Company or the U.S. SEC.
TITLE: SNIB - ANNOUNCES ODD LOT PROGRAM

TEXT: Stolt Sea Farm Expands Further in Chile    London, England June 06, 2000- Stolt-Nielsen S.A., (Nasdaq:   STLTF; STLBY; Oslo Stock Exchange; SNIB) today announced   that Stolt Sea Farm Holdings Ltd. (SSF) has reached   agreement in principle to purchase the remaining 49% of   Ocean Horizon S.A. in Chile which it does not already own.    Ocean Horizon is a subsidiary of International Aqua Foods   Ltd. which SSF purchased in 1999.  Subject to due   diligence, the deal is expected to close by the end of June   2000.    Ocean Horizon currently produces 1,800 tonnes of Atlantic   salmon on one site near Achou in Chile.  Ocean Horizons   also holds licenses for an additional eight approved sites   and has applications pending on two more.   SSF plans to   develop the additional sites and build production to some   6,000 tonnes by year 2003.      Niels G. Stolt-Nielsen, Managing Director of SSF said, This   is an important strategic investment to further develop our   sourcing base and it will add to our previously established   presence in Chile.  Together with our expansion in North   America, this will enable SSF to better serve the growing   demand for farmed Atlantic salmon in the US market.     Stolt Sea Farm, wholly-owned by Stolt-Nielsen S.A. (SNSA),   produces and markets high quality Atlantic salmon, salmon   trout, turbot, halibut, sturgeon, and caviar. Production   sites are located in Europe and the Americas with marketing   offices in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific. SNSA`s   Stolt-Nielsen Transportation Group Ltd. (SNTG) is one of   the world?s leading providers of transportation services   for bulk liquid chemicals, edible oils, acids, and other   specialty liquids.  SNTG, through its parcel tanker, tank   container, terminal, rail and barge services, provides   integrated transportation for its customers.  SNSA also   owns 53 percent of Stolt Offshore S.A. (Nasdaq: SCSWF,   SCSAY; Oslo Stock Exchange: SCS, SCSA), which is among the   largest subsea services contractors in the world.      This news release contains forward-looking statements as   defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform   Act of 1995.  Actual future results and trends could differ   materially from those set forth in such statements due to   various factors.  Additional information concerning these   factors is contained from time to time in the Company`s   U.S. SEC filings, including but not limited to the   Company`s report on Form 20-F for the year ended November   30, 1999.  Copies of these filings may be obtained by   contacting the Company or the U.S. SEC.
TITLE: SNIB - EXPANDS FUTHER IN CHILE

TEXT: London, England - June 9, 2000- Stolt Sea Farm Holdings Plc.   (SSF), a wholly owned subsidiary of Stolt-Nielsen S.A.   (Nasdaq: STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock Exhange: SNIB) today   announced it has applied for a listing on the main list of   the Oslo Stock Exchange.  SSF expects the Board of Directors   of the Oslo Stock Exchange to approve the application at its   monthly meeting on June 20, 2000.     In connection with the listing, 13,333,334 new Ordinary   Shares, representing 25 percent of the economic and voting   ownership of SSF, will be offered to the public.  The Global   Offering consists of an international institutional private   placement tranche and a Norwegian retail tranche.  The   international institutional tranche will be offered in a   private placement in the U.S. to accredited institutional   investors and outside the U.S. to buyers in offshore   transactions under Regulation S under the U.S. Securities   Act of 1933.    The issue price for the Global Offering will be determined   through an institutional book building process, which will   take place from June 13, 2000 to June 23, 2000.  The initial   offering price range, subject to change during the book   building period, has been set at  NOK 68.00 to NOK 81.00 per   share.  The final issue price for the Global Offering will   be determined by the Board of Directors of SSF on June 23,   2000, and will be announced on June 26, 2000.  The Norwegian   public offering has a subscription period from June 13, 2000   to June 23, 2000.    The Global Offering is being coordinated, managed and placed   by Christiania Markets and Orkla Enskilda Securities.  SSF   has agreed with the Managers to an over allotment option,   exercisable for 30 days after the listing date on the Oslo   Stock Exchange, by which SSF would issue additional Ordinary   Shares in a number up to a maximum of 10 percent of the   newly issued shares in the Global Offering.                 SSF produces and markets a variety of high quality marine   species and is one of the world`s largest producers of   Atlantic salmon and salmon trout with presence in all the   major salmon farming regions (North America, Norway, United   Kingdom and Chile). SSF is the world`s leading producer of   farmed turbot, halibut, sturgeon and sturgeon caviar, and   also produces tilapia in North America.  The Company`s   products are sold world wide under the Sterling brand name   through an in-market sales network in all three major   seafood markets (Asia, USA and Europe).    The information contained herein does not form part of any   offer of securities, or constitute a solicitation of any   offer to purchase or subscribe for securities, and any   purchase of or application for shares in the proposed   offering should be made on the basis of information   contained in the prospectus, to be issued in due course in   connection with the proposed offering, which document will   contain certain detailed information about SSF and its   management, as well as financial statements and other   financial information. The information contained herein is   not for publication or distribution to persons in the U.S.   and Canada. The securities referred to herein have not been   and will not be registered under the U.S. Securities Act   1933, as amended, and may not be offered for sale or sold   without registration thereunder or pursuant to an available   exemption therefrom.
TITLE: SNIB - ANNOUNCES THE INITIAL PUBLIC OFF.

TEXT: Oslo Børs har mottatt meldinger med følgende overskrifter:    Optimum Logistics and Capstan Systems Form Alliance to   Deliver e-Logistics Solution.    Optimum Logistics and Joseph Transportation Form Sea-to-Rail   e-Logistics Partnership.
TITLE: SNIB - AD OPTIMUM LOGISTICS

TEXT: Optimum Logistics and Joseph Transportation   Form Sea-to-Rail e-Logistics Partnership     -- Alliance Creates Premier Platform for Multi-modal Supply   Chain Management --     Stamford, Connecticut and Cincinnati, Ohio (June 12, 2000) -   Optimum Logistics, provider of the first Internet-based open   global logistics system for bulk materials, and Joseph   Transportation, North America`s premier supplier of   comprehensive railroad transportation services, today   announced a strategic alliance to integrate their online   logistics systems.  Combined, Optimum`s TransLink? suite of   products and Joseph`s RoadRunner? rail fleet management   system offer a web-enabled logistics solution that   electronically arranges and monitors multi-modal supply   chains.    Optimum and Joseph will offer their respective customers   access to both RoadRunner and TransLink systems.  The   reciprocal deal is designed to accelerate the rollout of   next-generation, multi-modal supply chain management for   industries including chemical, agribulk, steel and forest   products.    `While TransLink already supports integration with   customers` legacy rail fleet management systems, RoadRunner   brings a powerful new option to customers wishing to upgrade   their existing networks,` said Ken Bloom, Chief Operating   Officer of Optimum Logistics.  `We are pleased to partner   with Joseph Transportation.  Joseph`s long history in the   rail transportation business brings years of experience to   the deal, which in the long run will benefit our customers   through optimized utilization and improved efficiencies.`    Ultimately, TransLink aims to be the hub for the management   of commodity supply chains.    Optimum Logistics Partners with Joseph Transportation    `Joseph`s alliance with Optimum Logistics gives us an   opportunity to offer users of our RoadRunner system access   to the best-of-breed bulk material supply chain management   system,` said Kristine Barr, Director of Sales and Marketing   at Joseph Transportation.  `We are confident that our   partnership with Optimum will help accelerate the   integration of supply chain systems and promote a broader,   clearer perspective of the supply chain itself.`     Optimum Logistics  Optimum Logistics, based in Stamford, Connecticut, offers   the first Internet-based, open logistics system for   commodity goods.  TransLink?, Optimum`s primary offering,   incorporates information from every party that touches a   shipment, from producers to transportation, from storage   providers and freight forwarders to surveyors.    Stolt-Nielsen S.A. (Nasdaq: STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock   Exchange: SNIB) is the company`s first investor, and Optimum   is currently engaged in diluting Stolt`s stake to a minority   position.  For more information on Optimum Logistics and   TransLink visit www.optimumlogistics.com.    Joseph Transportation    Joseph Transportation provides comprehensive transportation   services.  Joseph Transportation owns and operates an active   portfolio of leased railcars serving railroads and industry,   owns a private fleet of railcars that transport commodities   in various markets throughout North America, and provides a   range of other financial and fleet management services for   railcar owners and lessees.  The RoadRunner? fleet   management system is Joseph`s proprietary shipping and   supply chain management service.  The system provides   real-time management of railcars, barges and inventory   anywhere in North America while facilitating e-commerce   activities.    This news release contains forward-looking statements as   defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act   of 1995.  Actual future results and trends could differ   materially from those set forth in such statements due to   various factors. Additional information concerning these   factors is contained from time to time in Stolt-Nielsen   S.A.`s (the Company) U.S. SEC filings, including but not   limited to the Company`s report on Form 20-F for the year   ended November 30, 1999.  Copies of these filings may be   obtained by contacting the Company or the U.S. SEC.
TITLE: SNIB - OPTIMUM LOGISTICS

TEXT: Optimum Logistics and Capstan Systems Form Alliance   to Deliver e-Logistics Solution      -- Integrated Platform Offers Global Solution For Bulk   Materials and Packaged Goods --    Stamford, Connecticut and San Francisco, California (June   14, 2000) - Optimum Logistics and Capstan Systems, Inc.,   today announced a strategic alliance that will expand   Optimum`s     e-logistics solution, TransLink?, beyond bulk   materials into packaged goods.  Optimum will integrate   Capstan`s B2B infrastructure for packaged goods e-logistics,   global import and global export execution, into TransLink.    The combined platform will offer shippers of commodity   materials access to critical logistics data both from their   packaged goods and bulk material supply chains on a single   Web site.     The integrated system, to be operated and marketed by   Optimum, will be a logistics backbone for private industry   consortia and public B2B e-marketplaces, including those   with whom Optimum has partnerships - CheMatch.com,   ChemConnect, ChemCross, and i2ichemicals.  It will deliver   unparalleled visibility and control over the entire supply   chain process - connecting all the parties who manage the   information, business process, regulatory compliance and   physical movement of goods required in international trade.    The platform is designed to streamline the logistics process   in a range of industries with combined bulk and packaged   goods requirements, including chemical, pharmaceutical,   forest products, steel, gas products and agribulk.    `Customers who have successfully used TransLink to sequence   their bulk material supply chains have requested TransLink   services for packaged goods,` said Ken Bloom, Chief   Operating Officer of Optimum Logistics.  `The integration of   Capstan`s system into TransLink will enable our customers to   efficiently manage a broader array of supply chains while   gaining increased visibility into each one.  We selected   Capstan because of their leadership in innovative Internet   technology and their global trade expertise in the packaged   goods arena.`    `Delivering supply chain execution solutions that can have   strategic impact for the chemical, agribulk and other   industries with high percentage of bulk logistics, requires   a very specialized expertise,` said Ron Alvarez, president   and CEO of Capstan Systems, Inc.  `Optimum Logistics has the   best-in-class solution for the bulk logistics market, and   when combined with Capstan`s technology, network and global   trade content expertise, will offer a solution that is   unique in its ability to enable strategic global business   advantages.`    About Optimum Logistics, Inc.  Optimum Logistics, based in Stamford, Connecticut, offers   the first Internet-based, open logistics system for   commodity goods.  Stolt-Nielsen, S.A (Nasdaq: STLTF, STLBY;   Oslo Stock Exchange: SNIB) is Optimum`s first investor, and   is presently in the process of diluting its stake in Optimum   to a minority position.  For more information on Optimum   Logistics and TransLink? visit www.optimumlogistics.com.     About Capstan Systems  Capstan Systems delivers a breakthrough business-to-business   Global Supply Chain Execution infrastructure optimized for   the new demands of an e-business world. A pioneering   web-native Business Services Provider (BSP), Capstan Systems   is creating a network linking all the participants in the   global trade transaction lifecycle, enabling a valuable   `network effect` for both corporate subscribers and   logistics services providers using the Capstan networked   application services. Capstan solutions are in use at major   corporations worldwide, and are integrated within i2   Technologies` freightMatrix and tradeMatrix electronic   marketplaces. By providing proactive visibility and control   over the global supply chain, Capstan enables companies and   digital exchanges to get the right goods to the right place,   at the right time--every time.    This news release contains forward-looking statements as   defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act   of 1995.  Actual future results and trends could differ   materially from those set forth in such statements due to   various factors. Copies of these filings may be   obtained by contacting the Company or the U.S. SEC.
TITLE: SNIB - E-LOGISTICS SOLUTION

TEXT: Stolt Sea Farm Holdings Announces Expected Second Quarter   2000 Results    London, England - June 19, 2000 - Stolt Sea Farm Holdings   plc (SSF), today announced it expects to report income from   operations for the second quarter ended May 31, 2000 of   approximately $10 million on net operating revenue of   approximately $79 million.  This compares with income from   operations of $10 million on net operating revenue of $73   million for second quarter of fiscal 1999.    For the six-month period ended May 31, 2000, SSF expects to   report $20 million income from operations on net operating   revenue of $151 million, compared with income from   operations of $10 million on net operating revenue of $126   million for the same period of 1999.     SSF has applied for a listing on the Oslo Stock Exchange and   expects to have its shares traded by the second week of   July.     SSF is a wholly owned subsidiary of Stolt-Nielsen S.A.   (Nasdaq: STLTF, STLBY; Oslo Stock Exchange: SNIB).     SSF produces and markets a variety of high quality marine   species and is one of the world`s largest producers of   Atlantic salmon and salmon trout with presence in all the   major salmon farming regions (North America, Norway, United   Kingdom and Chile). SSF is the world`s leading producer of   farmed turbot, halibut, sturgeon and sturgeon caviar, and   also produces tilapia in North America. The Company`s   products are sold world wide under the Sterling brand name   through an in-market sales network in all three major   seafood markets (Asia, USA and Europe).
TITLE: SNIB - SECOND QUARTER 2000 RESULTS

TITLE: SNIB - ERKLÆRING AV OPSJONER

TEXT: London, 25.Jun.00     Stolt Sea Farm announced today that it has decided not to   proceed with its Initial Public Offering of shares.  Despite   current interest in the aquaculture business, and   particularly in Stolt Sea Farm, insufficient interest was   expressed in the Oslo market to buy shares at a price that   Stolt Sea Farm`s owners believe reflects the value of the   company.  Niels G. Stolt-Nielsen, Stolt Sea Farm`s CEO,   said  `Stolt Sea Farm will continue to expand and invest in   salmon and other species, and build its sales and marketing   organisation globally.  It is disappointing that today`s   market perceives us as just another salmon farmer, who is   significantly exposed to an overheated salmon market in   Europe, and does not give us any credit for our profitable   achievements in turbot, halibut, and sturgeon/caviar   production; nor for our independently profitable market   organisation.   The opportunities are plentiful in this high   growth industry, and with the backing of our parent company,   Stolt-Nielsen SA, we shall continue to grow.`
TITLE: SNIB - RE SHARES

CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: Kraftig resultatframgang for Storebrand i 1999 -Solid  fundament for videre vekst    ? Driftsresultatet øker med 183% til 5.347 millioner kroner  ? Proforma konsernresultat utgjør 1.370 millioner kroner  ? Verdijustert avkastning i livselskapet er økt fra 3,5% til   15,7%  ? Storebrand er i løpet av 1999 blitt en vinner i markedet   for salg av Unit Linked og i nysalgsmarkedet for   verdipapirfond  ? Andelen eksterne midler til forvaltning er nær doblet  ? Styret foreslår et utbytte på 1 kr pr. aksje (første   utbytte siden 1993) Storebrandkonsernet har lagt bak seg et   år med gledelig resultatutvikling innenfor viktige  satsningsområder. Med utskillelsen av Storebrands   skadeforsikringsvirksomhet til If, er Storebrand  en fokusert aktør i det norske sparemarkedet.    -Resultatet for 1999 bekrefter det strategisk riktige i å   løfte vår skadevirksomhet opp på en  nordisk plattform. Jeg forventer en positiv utvikling i   bidraget fra skadeforsikring i løpet av  inneværende år. Samtidig viser årsresultatet at det nye   Storebrand har et godt fundament for å bli det ledende   spareselskap i Norge, sier konsernsjef Åge Korsvold i en   kommentar.    Gledelig markedsutvikling  Markedsutviklingen viser at Storebrand innen livsforsikring   har sikret seg en vekst i markedsandel på 4 prosentpoeng til   31 prosent. Gjennom året er posisjonen som Norges ledende   leverandør av liv- og pensjonsprodukter styrket blant annet   ved at Storebrand har hatt en gjennomsnittlig andel  av nysalget på 57 prosent i bedriftsmarkedet. I markedet for   Unit Linked er det solgt produkter for 1.434 millioner   kroner, noe som gir Storebrand plasseringen som landets   ledende Unit Linked-selskap. Storebrand er også en vinner   innen markedet for verdipapirfond i 1999. I løpet av året  økte markedsandelen fra 6,3 til 9,2 prosent, og ved utgangen   av året hadde Storebrand 11,1 milliarder kroner i   verdipapirforvaltning. Innen aktiv forvaltning ble kapitalen   doblet i 1999.    Sterkt finansresultat  Storebrand hadde i 1999 et driftsresultat på 5.347 millioner   kroner før tildeling av overskudd til kundene i livs- og   pensjonssparing. Dette er en framgang på 3.459 millioner   kroner fra året før, noe som i hovedsak skyldes utviklingen   i det norske og de internasjonale aksjemarkedene. Etter  tildeling av kundenes andel av overskuddet i livs- og   pensjonssparing, ble konsernresultatet 1.166 millioner   kroner, mot 603 millioner kroner året før. Proforma   konsernresultat for 1999 er på 1.370. Proforma regnskapet   viser den underliggende ordinære resultatutviklingen i   Storebrand med den nye strukturen som er etablert i 1999.  Netto premieinntekter for livvirksomhetene utgjorde 10.530   millioner kroner, mot 9.099 millioner kroner i 1998 - en   økning på 16%. Netto finansinntekter av   investeringsporteføljen i konsernet utgjør 15.830 millioner   kroner, som er 12.526 millioner kroner høyere enn i 1998.  Styret foreslår at Storebrand betaler et utbytte på 1 kr pr.   aksje. Selskapet vil tilstrebe en relativt stabil årlig   vekst i utbytte pr. aksje. Konsernets forvaltningskapital   økte i fjor med 18% til 150 milliarder kroner. Soliditeten i  konsernet er fremdeles svært god, og kapitaldekningen var   ved utgangen av året 14,0% mot 13,4% ved utgangen av 1998.   Ordinært resultat pr. aksje ble i fjor kr 3,38, mot kr 2,14   året før.  Resultat pr. aksje inkludert ekstraordinære poster ble kr   12,07.    Grunnlag for videre vekst  Storebrand og konsernsjef Åge Korsvold forventer at det   utvidede sparemarkedet vil vise betydelig vekst i årene som   kommer, og mener at selskapet er godt posisjonert for å ta   en vesentlig andel av denne veksten.    -Veksten vil for vår del komme som organisk vekst fra   eksisterende markedsområder og som resultat av nye   vekstinitiativer i Norge og internasjonalt.   Vekst kan også komme som et resultat av nye strukturer, sier   Korsvold. Han viser til at både i Norge og internasjonalt   har fusjoner og oppkjøp preget strukturutviklingen.  -Det er grunn til å tro at utviklingen fortsetter. Derfor er   det viktig for Storebrand at selskapet er godt posisjonert.   En viktig forutsetning er å være en konkurransedyktig aktør   i hjemmemarkedet, påpeker Korsvold.  Storebrand har etablert en rekke konkrete satsninger for å   realisere konsernets IT-strategi innen sparemarkedet, både i   forhold til ny systemplattform og Internett-satsning. Dette   innebærer at teknologiinvesteringer framover vil utgjøre en   vesentlig andel av konsernets samlede investeringer.
TITLE: STB - FORELØPIG ÅRSRESULTAT 1999 I

CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: Livsforsikring  Storebrand Livsforsikring gjør opp status for fjoråret med   økte markedsandeler, sterk vekst i driftsresultatet og en   kapitalavkastning som befester selskapets konkurransedyktige   posisjon. Verdijustert kapitalavkastning (eksklusiv   verdiendring i anleggsobligasjoner) i livselskapet utgjør  15,7%, som er 1,7%-poeng høyere enn benchmark og 12,2%-poeng   høyere enn tilsvarende periode i fjor. Bokført   kapitalavkastning utgjør 10,0 prosent, mot 5,9 prosent året   før.    Resultatet til fordeling mellom forsikringskunder og eiere   utgjør 4.956 millioner kroner før ekstraordinære poster, mot   1.781 millioner kroner i fjor, noe som utgjør en økning på   194%. Bokførte premier (inklusive mottatte premiereserver)   utgjør 9.264 millioner kroner. Kundenes  andel av det ordinære resultatet utgjør 4.181 millioner   kroner, som er 3.047 millioner kroner høyere enn i 1998.    Netto realiserte gevinster i livsforsikring utgjør 4.385   millioner kroner, som er 4.005 millioner kroner høyere enn   året før. Urealiserte gevinster, som er overført til   kursreguleringsfondet utgjør 5.868 millioner kroner, som   etter dette er på 8.596 millioner kroner. Kostnadsprosenten   målt i forhold til gjennomsnittlige kundefond øker fra 0,94   % til 0,96 %.    Unit Linked  1999 var et et særdeles godt år for salg av Storebrand-link   produkter. 1,46 milliarder kroner ble satt inn på   Storebrands IPA Link- og Livrente   Link-produkter. Tilsvarende tall i 1998 var 232  millioner kroner. Storebrand har dermed gått fra å ha 13   prosent av markedet i 1998 til å bli markedsleder med en   andel av markedet på 29 prosent i 1999.     Kapitalforvaltning  Storebrand ønsker å vokse innenfor kapitalforvaltning i   årene som kommer. Målet er å sikre selskapet er større andel   av et voksende kapitalforvaltningsmarked, og derigjennom   oppnå god lønnsomhet ut fra kritisk masse. I løpet av   fjoråret har Storebrand kjøpt Finansbanken og  Storebrand Kapitalforvaltning har etablert egen virksomhet i   Sverige. Midler under forvaltning er økt med 21 prosent til   147 milliarder kroner, noe som befester Storebrands posisjon   som Norges største private kapitalforvalter. Forvaltningen   fra eksterne kunder, både gjennom verdipapirfond og   diskresjonære porteføljer (aktiv forvaltning), har i løpet   av fjoråret vokst fra 8,9% til 13,7% av totalt   forvaltningsvolum. I løpet av året økte kapitalen til   forvaltning innen verdipapirfond med 4,7 milliarder kroner   til 11,1 milliarder kroner, noe som gir en markedsandel på   9,2% (inklusive Delphi). Innenfor aksjefond spesielt, var   markedsandelen 11,0%. Innen området aktiv forvaltning ble   kapitalen fordoblet i 1999, og var ved utgangen av året 11,5   milliarder kroner.    Storebrand Bank  Storebrand Bank ble også i fjor kåret til Norges beste   Internett-bank. Banken har en god kundevekst, og opplevde i   fjor at over halvparten av lønnskontokundene er blitt faste   nettkunder. Storebrand Bank Konsern, som i tillegg til   Storebrand Bank omfatter Storebrand Finans AS, hadde  et årsresultat på 5 millioner kroner. Netto renteinntekter   økte som følge av økt balanse og økt rentemargin. Banken   hadde en kjernekapitaldekning på 15,3 prosent ved   årsskiftet.    Finansbanken  Finansbanken ASA ble i fjor overtatt 100 prosent av   Storebrand ASA. Målet med oppkjøpet er å gjøre Finansbanken   til landets ledende privatbank. Finansbanken Konsern   oppnådde for 1999 et resultat etter tap på 168 millioner   kroner, noe som gir en avkastning på egenkapitalen på 17,1%.  Resultatet i 1998 var 143 millioner kroner. Rentemargin og   rentenetto er i perioden oppretthold på et stabilt nivå   sammenlignet med 1998. Rentemarginen utgjorde 2,50% av   gjennomsnittlig forvaltningskapital. Finansbanken har i 1999  kjøpt Delphi Forvaltning.    Øvrig virksomhet  Storebrand mottok konsesjon for deltagelse i If-samarbeidet   20. desember-99. I regnskapet til Storebrand er det som   følge av transaksjonen tatt inn en gevinst på 3.230   millioner kroner, som er ført som en ekstraordinær post i   regnskapet. Oslo Re fikk et resultat på 115 millioner kroner   i fjor. Dette er ført direkte mot egenkapitalen i henhold   til god regnskapsskikk.    Holdingselskapet Storebrand ASA fikk et driftsresulatet   inkludert konsernbidrag på 1.334 millioner kroner, mot 504   millioner kroner i 1998. Storebrand Helseforsikring AS og   Fair Forsikring, som begge startet sin virksomhet høsten   1998, hadde henholdsvis 6 millioner og 12 millioner kroner i  premieinntekter i 1999.
TITLE: STB - FORELØPIG ÅRSRESULTAT 1999 II

TEXT: Finansbanken ASA inngikk i 4. kvartal 1999 avtale om kjøp   av 89% av aksjene i Delphi Forvaltning AS. Kredittilsynet   har på vegne av Finansdepartementet i brev av 26. mars d.å.   gitt godkjennelse til å erverve aksjene og til endring i   organiseringen av Storebrandkonsernet og delkonsernet   Finansbanken ASA.   Godkjenningen av konsernstrukturen er tidsmessig begrenset   til den periode Storebrand er gitt konsesjon til å   opprettholde Storebrand Bank AS og Finansbanken ASA som   separate enheter.   Delphi Forvaltning AS kan såvel i 4. kvartal 1999 og 1.   kvartal 2000 vise til stigende forretningsvolumer og sterk   avkastning i alle porteføljer. Delphi eier også 34% i   E*Trade Norge som snart lanserer aksjehandel på internett i   allianse med Finansbanken og Storebrand Bank.    Kontaktpersoner:  Adm.dir.i Finansbanken,Geir Andersen,tlf.22 47 40 91  Adm.dir.i Delphi,Per Olav Langaker, tlf. 22 01 53 81
TITLE: STB - Delphi Forvaltning AS - Konsesjon

TEXT: Storebrand and Skandia comment as follows on the report   issued today by the Board of Directors of Pohjola on the   P&C insurance company if...   In the report the Board recommends that the Annual General   Meeting of Pohjola convene an extraordinary shareholders?   meeting.    Storebrand and Skandia today sent a letter to the Board of   Pohjola stating:  `Pohjola has together with Skandia and Storebrand entered   into the Master Agreement and the Variation Agreements   warranting that it has full corporate power and authority   to do so. The agreements have been drafted after legal   advice from respected lawyers and are duly signed by each   party`s authorised signatories. The agreements are legally   valid, binding and enforceable`    The statements by the Board of Pohjola create a unfortunate   situation for the customers and employees of if... in   Finland.     No further comments will be made by Skandia or Storebrand
TITLE: STB - If... Finland

TEXT: I forbindelse med aksjekjøpsordning 2000 for ansatte i   Storebrand har Ronny Johan Langeland den 7.4.2000 benyttet   seg av tilbudet om å kjøpe 150 aksjer i Storebrand ASA til   tegningskurs kr. 40,-.  Etter tildeling vil han eie 350   antall aksjer i Storebrand ASA.
TITLE: STB - MELDEPLIKTIG HANDEL

TEXT: Storebrand og Skandia gir følgende kommentar med henvisning   til rapporten som styret i Pohjola mandag offentliggjorde   vedrørende det nordiske skadeforsikringsselskapet If. I   rapporten foreslås det blant annet at  generalforsamling i   Pohjola vedtar å innkalle til en ekstraordinær   generalforsamling.    Storebrand og Skandia har idag (mandag) sendt et brev til   Pohjolas styre hvor selskapene meddeler at:   `Pohjola, har sammen med Skandia og Storebrand inngått en   Master Agreement og flere Variation Agreements. I samtlige   avtaler har Pohjola garantert at selskapet har alle   nødvendige mandater og fullmakter som kreves for å inngå   avtalene. Avtalene er inngått etter rådgivning av   anerkjente advokater og er undertegnet av autoriserte   signaturer fra hver av partene. Avtalene er juridisk   gyldig, bindende og kan håndheves.`    Uttalelsene fra Pohjolas styre skaper en beklagelig   situasjon for Ifs kunder og ansatte i Finland.    Ingen flere kommentarer vil bli gitt av Skandia og   Storebrand.     Oslo 11/4 2000    Storebrand   Informasjonsavdelingen
TITLE: STB - If...  Finnland

TEXT: Styret i Storebrand har gitt administrasjonen i fullmakt å   inngå en avtale om outsourcing av IT-Infrastruktur. Avtalen   ønskes inngått samlet for et konsortium bestående av If,   Skandia, ICA og Storebrand. Den er tiårig og omfatter for   Storebrand et tjenesteomfang, målt i 2000-kroner på kr 120   mill. Samlet besparelse i enhetspriser forventes å bli 20 -   25%.    Oslo, 10. mai 2000
TITLE: STB - Outsourcing av IT-tjenester

TEXT: Oslo Børs har mottatt protokoll fra ordinær   generalforsamling.
TITLE: STB - MOTTATT PROTOKOLL

TEXT: Kommentarer fra Storebrand og Skandia vedrørende Pohjolas   vedtak om If samarbeidet    Pohjolas generalforsamling besluttet i dag ensidig å heve   den juridisk ugjenkallelige og bindende avtalen som er   inngått mellom Storebrand, Skandia og Pohjola om   etableringen av det nordiske skadeforsikringsselskapet If.    I en felles kommentar sier Hans Henrik Klouman og Jan-  Mikael Bexhed, som er Storebrands resp. Skandias   sjefsjurister:    `Det er svært beklagelig og overraskende at et stort   børsnotert selskap som Pohjola, som dessuten står under   offentlig tilsyn, motsetter seg å følge en bindende avtale.   Vi må i den situasjonen som er oppstått utnytte alle legale   muligheter slik at vi på en best mulig måte kan ivareta   Storebrand- og Skandia-aksjonærenes interesser. Storebrand   og Skandia kommer derfor til å innlede en voldgiftsprosess   mot Pohjola i samsvar med den avtalte   tvisteløsningsmekanisme. I voldgiftssaken kommer Storebrand   og Skandia bl.a. å kreve en ikke ubetydelig   skadeerstatning. På denne bakgrunn er vurderingen at det   inntrufne ikke kommer til å få noen effekt på Storebrands   og Skandias stilling.`    Ifs nordiske strategi påvirkes ikke av Pohjolas handling.    Stockholm/Oslo  16. mai 2000        Kontaktpersoner:  Sjefsjurist Hans Henrik Klouman, Storebrand + 47 22 31 50   50   Informasjonsdirektør Egil Thompson, Storebrand + 47 22 48   95 86 - 93 48 00 12  Sjefsjurist Jan Mikael Bexhed, Skandia + 46 8788 10 000  Pressesjef Birgittas Hammarström, Skandia + 46 8788 27 55 -   070- 378 2755
TITLE: STB - Pohjolas vedtak om If

TEXT: Storebrands representantskap har på sitt møte 23. mai 2000   gjenvalgt Jon R. Gundersen og Leif L. Nergaard som hhv.   formann og nestformann i styret i Storebrand ASA. I tillegg   er Halvor Stenstadvold fra Orkla valgt som nytt styremedlem   etter Tom Vidar Rygh. Alle disse styremedlemmene er valgt   for 2 år.    Representantskapet gjenvalgte Sven Ullring, Jens P.   Heyerdahl og Morten Rambech Dahl som medlemmer av   valgkomiteen for ett år. TEXT: Storebrand Bank setter opp  innskudds- og utlånsrentene    Storebrand Bank har besluttet å sette opp rentene på   innskudd og utlån. Årsaken til renteendringene er   utviklingen i pengemarkedet. Innskudd i Storebrand Bank   øker med inntil 0,50 prosentpoeng, mens lån øker med inntil   0,35 prosentpoeng.    For nye lån gis renteendringen virkning fra 31. mai.   Eksisterende lån og innskudd endres med virkning fra   slutten av juni.    Etter renteendringen vil Storebrand Bank tilby en rente på   6 prosent for innskudd mellom 100.000 og 500.000 kroner.   Gunstigste lånerente blir på 6,70 prosent nominelt og 6,98   prosent effektivt.     Storebrand  Oslo, 26. mai 2000    Kontaktpersoner:  Adm. direktør Kai G. Henriksen: 22311196 -92847820  Informasjonsdirektør Egil Thompson, 22489586 - 93480012
TITLE: STB - Innskudds- og utlånsrente opp

TEXT: Se vedlegg
TITLE: STB - Styringsstrukturen forenkles

TEXT: Embedded Value for Storebrand Livsforsikring AS    Storebrand har idag offentliggjort embedded value for   Storebrand Livsforsikring AS. Embedded value er nåverdien   av fremtidige overskudd etter skatt på dagens portefølje i   tillegg til egenkapitalen i selskapet. Endringen i embedded   value fra ett år til det neste kalles for embedded value   resultat. Embedded value er viktig som et styringsverktøy   for selskapet.    Embedded value ved utgangen av 1999 er beregnet til 8,040   mill. kroner (etter justering for utbytte på 643 mill.   kroner) som består av en egenkapital på 2,949 mill. kroner   og en verdi av porteføljen på 5,091 mill. kroner. Ved   utgangen av 1998 var embedded value 6,750 mill. kroner, og   besto da av en egenkapital på 2,839 mill. kroner og en   verdi på porteføljen på 3,911 mill. kroner. Det innebærer   at embedded value resultatet for 1999 var 1,933 mill.   kroner, og som besto av renter på inngående embedded value   på 758 mill. kroner, verdi av ny forretning tegnet i 1999   på 194 mill. kroner og avvik mellom forventet og virkelig   result av driften (inkludert endringer i urealiserte   gevinster) på 981 mill. kroner.    En gjennomgang av embedded value beregningene finnes på   storebrand.no/investor relations.      Oslo, 8. juni 2000
TITLE: STB - Embedded Value for Storebrand Liv

TEXT: STOLT COMEX SEAWAY S.A. ANNOUNCES  FIRST QUARTER RESULTS AND CONTRACT AWARDS    Aberdeen, Scotland - March 27, 2000 - Stolt Comex Seaway   S.A. (Nasdaq: SCSWF, SCSAY; Oslo Stock Exchange: SCS, SCSA)   today reported results for the first quarter ended February   29, 2000.  Net loss for the latest quarter was $(15.7)   million, or $(0.25) per share, on net operating revenue of   $192.3 million, compared with net income of $0.6 million, or   $0.01 per share, on net operating revenue of $145.1 million   for the same period last year. The weighted average number   of common share equivalents outstanding for the quarter was   63 million compared with 59 million for the same period of   1999. Following the issuance of shares to Group GTM on   February 4th and to the Stolt-Nielsen Transportation Group   Ltd on February 25th the number of shares outstanding as of   February 29th 2000 was 77.5 million.  The result for the   quarter reflects a one-off gain of $2.2 million from the   sale of assets.    Commenting on the results, Bernard Vossier, Chief Executive   Officer, said `Market conditions throughout the quarter in   the UK sector of the North Sea, the Gulf of Mexico and Asia   Pacific continue to be very weak.  In addition, in the   Danish sector of the North Sea the Maersk Halfdan pipelay   program has experienced significant weather delays as has   the installation of the Saga Tordis template moorings in the   Norwegian sector. The weather related delays on both of   these projects have had a significant negative impact on   earnings in the quarter. In the UK sector the Amerada Hess   Triton FPSO, which was to have been towed out and hooked up   in the first quarter was not towed out until March 17th.    Revenues from this project will move to the second quarter.    `We have recently been awarded three contracts in the North   Sea and in West Africa.  The first of these is a $48 million   contract from Triton Energy for the first phase of the   development of the La Cieba field offshore Equitorial   Guinea. This is a very fast track project, in a water depth   of 900 metres, for which our recently enhanced engineering   ability and assets are well suited.  The project involves   the installation and tie-in of 60 kms of 8 5/8` rigid   flowlines, 2.8 kms of flexible risers and 60 kms of well   control umbilicals to connect each of the first four   production wells to an FPSO.  A 614 T subsea support   structure for the subsea well control umbilicals and risers   will be fabricated at the Stolt Offshore yard in Nigeria.   The Seaway Polaris and the Seaway Falcon will undertake the   installation work in the third quarter of this year.    `The second contract to be awarded is the Statoil seabed   mapping, pipelay support and pipeline inspection frame   contract for the Norwegian sector of the North Sea is for   three years with two additional two-year options.  The   contract includes general survey work, shallow water survey   and other work within the capacity of the survey ship.    There is also a provision for technology development   throughout the life of the contract.    `The third award is a $10 million contract in the UK sector   of the North Sea for the tie-back of BP Amoco`s South   Everest subsea wells to the CATS riser platform.  This   involves the installation and trenching of a 7.4 km flexible   flowline and control umbilical.  The flexible flowline, to   be supplied by NKT Flexibles will have an unplasticised PVdF   liner to accommodate high well temperatures. It will be the   longest flowline of its type to be used offshore.  The   installation work at South Everest is scheduled for the   third quarter of 2000.     `Our backlog now stands at $1.2 billion of which $697   million is for the remainder of 2000, with the balance for   future years.  This compares with a backlog of $1.3 billion   at the same time last year of which $837 million was for   1999. The 1999 comparative figures include the backlog for   ETPM at that time.    `The integration of ETPM into Stolt Offshore is proceeding   well. The new organisation was in place on February 16th.    The integration team is now working on establishing common   working practices and processes throughout the group and   redeveloping the corporate management systems to suit the   wider capabilities of the new company, with a target date to   implement these new systems of June 1st.  The previously   announced synergies and savings from bringing the two   companies together will start to show from the second half   of this year.  Attached on www.ose.no is the complete press release.
TITLE: SCS/SCSA - 1ST QUARTER RESULT I

CATEGORY: HALVÅRSRAPPORTER OG REVISJONSBERETNINGER / UTTALELSER OM FORENKLET REVISORKONTROLL
TEXT: `The subsea construction sector is always the last to   benefit from increased exploration and production   expenditure and we therefore do not expect to see any   significant increase in the level of activity this year.   Market conditions will therefore continue to be weak for the   remainder of 2000, particularly in the UK sector of the   North Sea, the Gulf of Mexico and in Asia Pacific and   accordingly we expect that our second quarter and full year   results will be lower than consensus estimates.      `There are now clear indications of a significant increase   in market volume in 2001 and we therefore expect to see   stronger market conditions.  In support of this view, the   level of bids outstanding for 2001 is now at a record level   and we expect to see more very large projects for West   Africa come into the market later this year.`  Mr. Vossier   concluded.
TITLE: SCS/SCSA - 1ST QUARTER RESULT II

TEXT: STOLT COMEX SEAWAY S.A. CHANGES NAME  TO STOLT OFFSHORE S.A.     Aberdeen, Scotland - May 11, 2000 - At its Annual General   Meeting on April 13th, Stolt Comex Seaway S.A. (Nasdaq:   SCSWF, SCSAY; Oslo Stock Exchange: SCS, SCSA) changed its   name to Stolt Offshore S.A.  At the same meeting Bernard   Vossier, Chief Executive Officer of Stolt Offshore and   Pierre Laborie, previously Vice-Chairman and President of   ETPM, were elected to the Board of Directors.    Bernard Vossier, Chief Executive Officer of Stolt Offshore   commented, `The change of the company name to Stolt Offshore   follows the acquisition of ETPM and 49% of NKT Flexibles in   December last year which has more than doubled the market in   which the company competes and has significantly   strengthened our asset base.`    Stolt Offshore is a leading offshore contractor to the oil   and gas industry, specialising in technologically   sophisticated offshore and subsea engineering, flowline and   pipeline lay, construction, inspection and maintenance   services.  The Company operates in Europe, the Middle East,   West Africa, Asia Pacific, and the Americas.    This news release contains forward looking statements as   defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act   of 1995.  Actual future results and trends could differ   materially from those set forth in such statements due to   various factors.  Additional information concerning these   factors is contained from time to time in the Company`s U.S.   SEC filings, including but not limited to the Company`s   report on form 20-F for the year ended November 30, 1998.    Copies of these filings may be obtained by contacting the   Company or the SEC.
TITLE: SCS - CHANGES NAME TODAY

(Nasdaq: SCSWF, SCSAY; Oslo Stock Exchange: SCS, SCSA)   announced today it plans to replace its three largest   exsisting banking arrangements with a new $400 million   revolving credit facility. TITLE: SCS - PLANS REFINANCING

TEXT: Aberdeen, Scotland ? May 23, 2000 ? Stolt Offshore S.A.   (Nasdaq: SCSWF, SCSAY; Oslo Stock Exchange: SCS, SCSA)   announced today it plans to replace its three largest   existing banking arrangements with a new $400 million   revolving credit facility. In December 1999 the Company   completed the acquisition of ETPM which was partially funded   by a short-term bridge facility which will be replaced by   this refinancing.  The Company expects the bank refinancing   to be completed during its fiscal third quarter.  In   addition to the bank refinancing, Stolt-Nielsen S.A. (SNSA),   the parent of Stolt Offshore, will make an additional   investment of $100 million through the purchase of 9.43   million Stolt Offshore Class A Shares.  The investment by   SNSA, which takes effect on or about May 26, 2000 is   based on the average value of the Class A shares in the   fourteen day period immediately preceding the Stolt Offshore   Board meeting on May 5th at which this action was approved   and will increase SNSA?s ownership of Stolt Offshore to 53%.    Bernard Vossier, Chief Executive Officer of Stolt Offshore   commented, ?This refinancing and the investment by SNSA   provide additional liquidity and strengthen our balance   sheet at a time when we continue to experience weak market   conditions in the UK sector of the North Sea, the Gulf of   Mexico and in Asia Pacific. These market conditions,   combined with the delay of several projects into next year,   mean that uncertainties remain as to the final level of   revenues and earnings for the full year with some 20% of   anticipated revenues yet to be awarded. Accordingly second   quarter and full year earnings will fall short of current   estimates.    Looking ahead we see clear evidence of firming market   conditions for 2001, and a recovery in the offshore   construction sector. I am confident that Stolt Offshore is   now very well positioned to profit from the improving market   conditions which we see for 2001 and for subsequent years,?   concluded Mr Vossier.    Stolt Offshore is a leading offshore contractor to the oil   and gas industry, specialising in technologically   sophisticated offshore and subsea engineering, flowline and   pipeline lay, construction, inspection and maintenance   services.  The Company operates in Europe, the Middle East,   West Africa, Asia Pacific, and the Americas. Copies of these filings may be obtained by contacting the   Company or the SEC.
TITLE: SCS - PLANS REFINANCING

TEXT: TGS-NOPEC Oppstart av ny seismisk survey offshore Texas  Houston, Texas 13. mars 2000.  TGS-NOPEC annonserte idag   oppstart av fase 48A; en ny multiklient 2D survey offshore   Texas, vest i Mexicogulfen.     Fase 48A blir innsamlet i partnerskap med det kinesiske   selskapet Chinese Offshore Oil Geophysical Corporation   (COOGC). COOGC`s skip M/V Bin Hai 512 begynte å innsamle   testlinjer for prosjektet i januar 2000.  Etter evaluering   av prosesserte resultater, starter nå TGS-NOPEC og COOGC den   første 16,000-kilometer fasen av et planlagt to-fase program   med 8.000 meter lang streamerkabel og overlegen teknologi i   forhold til forefinnende prosjekter i området.TGS-NOPEC`s   prosesseringsekvens inkluderer pre-stack time migration og   AVO analyse.
TITLE: TGS - NY SEISMISK SURVEY OFFSHORE TEXAS

TEXT: TGS-NOPEC Begins New Seismic Survey Offshore Texas    Houston, Texas, March 13, 2000 - TGS-NOPEC Geophysical   Company (OSLO:TGS) today announced the commencement of the   Phase 48A 2D non-exclusive seismic program on the offshore   Texas shelf area within the Western Gulf of Mexico.      Phase 48A is being acquired in partnership with Chinese   Offshore Oil Geophysical Corporation (COOGC). COOGC?s   vessel M/V Bin Hai 512 began to acquire test lines for the   project in January 2000. Following evaluation of processed   results, TGS-NOPEC and COOGC are now launching the first   16,000-kilometer phase of a planned two-phase program. The   8,000-meter streamer lengths and 13-second  record lengths   incorporated into Phase 48A far exceed the acquisition   technology available on any previous projects in the area.   TGS-NOPEC?s processing sequence for Phase 48A includes pre-  stack time migration and amplitude versus offset (AVO)   analysis.       `We believe that there is untapped potential in the deeper   geological section in this area of the Gulf of Mexico`,   said John Adamick, President of TGS-NOPEC Offshore   Division. `Our goal with Phase 48A is to provide   explorationists with a better set of tools to image these   deeper structures and evaluate their potential for   hydrocarbons. The AVO products should help to illuminate   Type II gas sands in the area. These benefits, when   combined with the large amount of unleased acreage covered   by the new data, should make the project highly attractive   to our clients.`    TGS-NOPEC is a leading global provider of non-exclusive   seismic data and associated products to the oil and gas   industry.  Oil companies use this seismic data to explore   for oil and gas deposits.  TGS-NOPEC specializes in the   planning, acquisition, processing, interpretation, and   marketing of non-exclusive surveys worldwide.  TGS-NOPEC   places a strong focus on providing high quality seismic   data and the highest level of service to the industry.    Other business markets include proprietary seismic   acquisition and processing services, as well as gravity and   aeromagnetic surveys.    TGS-NOPEC is listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange (OSLO:TGS).    For additional information about this news release please   contact:    TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company  Karen El-Tawil   2500 CityWest Boulevard, Suite 2000  Houston, TX  77042  713-860-2100  www.tgsgeo.com
TITLE: TGS - Begins New Seismic Survey

TEXT: TGS-NOPEC To Acquire New Seismic Survey Offshore   Newfoundland    Houston, Texas, April 7, 2000 - TGS-NOPEC Geophysical   Company ASA (OSLO:TGS) today announced plans to acquire   over 12,000 kilometers of new non-exclusive 2D seismic data   offshore Eastern Canada.     The program, referred to as the Tail of the Bank survey,   extends TGS-NOPEC`s existing deepwater regional coverage   from Nova Scotia into and around the Grand Banks area of   offshore Newfoundland, bringing the Company`s total Eastern   Canada 2D library to over 45,000 kilometers. Several oil   companies have committed substantial pre-funding to the   project.    TGS-NOPEC has contracted a Schlumberger operated seismic   vessel, the M/V Akademik Shatskiy, to complete the   recording phase. The vessel is currently in transit from   Brazil where it recorded over 20,000 kilometers of the TGS-  NOPEC / Schlumberger Alliance Brasil`99 Seismic Program.   Acquisition of Tail of the Bank is scheduled to begin in   early May.     ?We are pleased to return to Canada for the third   consecutive summer season. TGS-NOPEC   has made a commitment to become a leading seismic data   provider in the Canada market and   the support we have received for the Tail of the Bank   project further demonstrates our progress?, says Kim   Abdallah, President of International New Ventures. ?This   program fits perfectly into   TGS-NOPEC?s strategy of acquiring modern regional seismic   data along the Atlantic Margins.    TGS-NOPEC has ongoing Atlantic Margin programs in Brazil,   Canada, Greenland, the Faroes, Portugal, and Morocco.    TGS-NOPEC is a leading global provider of non-exclusive   seismic data and associated products to the oil and gas   industry. Oil companies use this seismic data to explore   for and develop oil and gas deposits. TGS-NOPEC specializes   in the planning, acquisition, processing, interpretation,   and marketing of non-exclusive surveys worldwide. The   company places a strong emphasis on providing high quality   seismic data and the highest level of service to the   industry. TGS-NOPEC also offers proprietary seismic   acquisition and processing services, as well as gravity and   aeromagnetic surveys.    TGS-NOPEC is listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange (OSLO:TGS).    For additional information about this news release please   contact:    TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company  J. Kim Abdallah  2500 CityWest Boulevard, Suite 2000  Houston, TX  77042  +1-713-860-2100  www.tgsgeo.com  or Arne Helland (CFO) at +47-31-29-20-33/+47-91-88-78-29
TITLE: TGS-To Acquire New Seismic Survey
